snippet: Turmoil at a leading newspaper is posing an early challenge for Xi Jinping, pitting a pent-up demand for change against the Communist Party’s desire for a firm grip.
abstract: News analysis; turmoil over censorship at leading Chinese newspaper Southern Weekend is posing early challenge to political program of new Chinese leader Xi Jinping, pitting pent-up popular demand for change against Communist Party's desire to maintain firm grip.

byline.contributor: Jonathan Ansfield contributed reporting from Beijing, and Chris Buckley from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: Turmoil at a leading newspaper is posing an early challenge for Xi Jinping, pitting a pent-up demand for change against the Communist Party’s desire for a firm grip.

headline.seo: Chinese Newspaper, Southern Weekend, Challenges Censors
headline.main: Test for New Leaders as Chinese Paper Takes On Censors
headline.print_headline: Test for New Leaders as Chinese Paper Takes On Censors
